tutorial.welcomeDesc: Your ultimate tool for secure communication and digital camouflage. Let's get you started!
tutorial.rsaAesDesc: Toggle between modes in the Crypt panel to suit your needs.
tutorial.rsaAesTip: üí° Pro Tip: Use AES (Symmetric) for your own files. Use ECC (Asymmetric) to send secrets to friends.
tutorial.eccStep1Desc: First, go to the ID panel and generate your Identity Card. This allows others to send you secure messages using X25519.
tutorial.eccStep2Desc: Send your card file to a friend. When they send you theirs, click 'Import Card'. They will appear in your contacts.
tutorial.eccStep3Desc: In the Crypt panel, select 'Asymmetric (ECC)'. Pick your friend from the list. Now, only *they* can decrypt the message.
tutorial.aesStep1Desc: Uses the same key for encryption and decryption. Ideal for personal files or quick sharing.
tutorial.aesStep2Desc: To read the message, the recipient must enter the exact same password.
tutorial.stegoDesc: Hide your encrypted data inside normal-looking images! Upload an image, embed your secrets, and share the PNG.

id.title: Operator Card
id.analogy: Every operator needs a certified profile. This profile (public key) is public, but only your private seal (private key) can sign it. Exchanging cards is exchanging trust.
id.tech: The ID card is a JSON container with an X25519 public key and name, plus a digital signature. The system verifies this signature on import to prevent tampering.

ecc.title: ECC: X25519 Exchange
ecc.analogy: Think of it as mixing colors. You have a private color, and there is a public color. By mixing them (mathematically), you create a shared secret color that no one else can replicate without your private base.
ecc.tech: X25519 is a high-speed Elliptic Curve protocol. Unlike the ancient RSA (slow Arts), ECC is lightweight and extremely fast, generating shared secrets (ECDH) to establish secure channels instantly.

aes.title: AES: Secure Frequency
aes.analogy: A direct, encrypted radio frequency between two Operators. You both must tune to the exact same frequency (Key). The challenge is sharing that frequency without Reunion intercepting it.
aes.tech: AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) scrambles data like a fast-cast Arts barrier. It is extremely efficient, perfect for transmitting large combat data logs once the secure link is established.

stego.title: LSB Camouflage
stego.analogy: We modulate the color values of an image so slightly that the naked eye sees nothing amiss. Like Manticore's invisibility, the data is hidden in plain sight, waiting for a scanner to reveal it.
stego.tech: We manipulate the Least Significant Bit of each pixel's Originium color value. Modifying a Red value from 255 to 254 is invisible to standard observation. Warning: Compression (like JPEG) disrupts this delicate Arts weave.
